info.title: SQLite Database Context Server
info.description: A comprehensive MCP server specification for mcp-server-sqlite, providing tools for connection management, full schema introspection, and both read-only and modifying SQL execution (CRUD/DDL).

connect_database.description: Establishes a connection to a specific SQLite database file, optionally setting an alias for future reference.

path.description: The absolute file path to the SQLite database file (e.g., '/home/user/data/mydatabase.db').

alias.description: An optional, user-friendly name to reference this connection (defaults to the file name).

readonly.description: If true, the connection is opened in read-only mode.

response.description: A confirmation message including the connection's assigned alias.

close_connection.description: Closes the connection to a specific SQLite database, freeing up the resource.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database to close.

response.description: A confirmation that the connection has been successfully closed.

get_catalog.description: Retrieves a comprehensive catalog of the database, including all tables, views, and their full column definitions in a single call.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database.

response.description: A JSON or string representation of the complete database schema catalog.

get_table_info.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific table, including its schema, indexes, row count, and a small sample of data.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database.

table_name.description: The name of the table to analyze.

sample_rows.description: Optional: The number of sample rows to return (default: 5).

response.description: A structured output containing schema, row count, and sample data for the table.

execute_read_query.description: Executes a read-only SQL SELECT query. This intent is safe for retrieving data without modification.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database.

query.description: The SQL SELECT query to be executed.

limit.description: Optional: Maximum number of rows to return (default: 100).

response.description: The results of the query, formatted as a Markdown table or a JSON array.

execute_write_query.description: Executes a modifying SQL query (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, or DDL like CREATE TABLE/DROP TABLE). Use with caution.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database.

query.description: The modifying SQL query (e.g., INSERT INTO..., UPDATE..., DELETE FROM..., CREATE TABLE...).

response.description: A confirmation message indicating success and the number of rows affected.

create_view.description: Creates a new SQL view based on a SELECT query, which can be useful for simplifying complex data retrieval for the AI or external services.

database_alias.description: The alias of the connected database.

view_name.description: The name to assign to the new view.

query.description: The SQL SELECT query that defines the view's data.

description.description: An optional description of the view's purpose for context.
